headline: Staff Applied Scientist | InMobi | DataTrek | Meesho | Walmart | IIIT-Hyderabad
summary: I work as a Staff Data Scientist at InMobi, an AdTech firm. Previously, I worked with Meesho and Walmart. I hold a master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science from IIIT-Hyderabad and have over 9 years of experience in areas such as Supply Chain, Pricing, Fraud Analytics, Recommendation Systems, and Advertising platforms.   I also create and share content on my YouTube channel, DataTrek, where I cover topics like Gen AI, Machine Learning, Statistics, industrial ML projects, ML design problems, research papers, tech blogs, and Data Science interview preparation.   Outside of work, I enjoy working out and practicing & watching Mixed Martial Arts.
position_description_1: After a fulfilling and enriching journey, I was thrilled to join InMobi‚ÄîIndia's first unicorn and a global leader in mobile advertising. I came onboard to continue deepening my AdTech expertise, working in a high-impact, performance-driven environment.  Currently, I‚Äôm part of InMobi‚Äôs DSP (Demand-Side Platform) business, solving complex challenges in the AdTech ecosystem. My primary focus lies in the Bidding team, where I lead the Bid Shading module‚Äîa system designed to strategically lower bids to win auctions at the best possible price, striking the right balance between win rate and supplier ROI. This work requires tight collaboration across Targeting and Supply Path Optimization teams, and involves close interaction with engineers, product managers, data scientists, and business stakeholders.  We built a state-of-the-art ensemble neural network model to power bid shading‚Äîenhancing accuracy in price prediction and improving auction efficiency at scale.  Beyond Bid Shading, I also contribute to Remarketing initiatives, aimed at re-engaging high-value users and driving performance for advertisers.  My work spans optimizing bidding strategies, refining demand-supply alignment, and improving traffic acquisition‚Äîall geared towards winning key auctions and maximizing ROI.
position_description_2: Topmate has been the best way to connect with me for anything and everything related to careers, data science, and mentorship. I'm proud to have completed 250+ bookings, and incredibly grateful for the heartfelt testimonials and high rate of repeat sessions. I've been honored to be recognized as a Top Mentor for two consecutive years, and deeply humbled when Topmate featured me on a Times Square, New York billboard.  Through this platform, I‚Äôve had the privilege to mentor individuals who‚Äôve gone on to land roles at companies like Spotify (London), Meta, Walmart, Target, Deloitte, and various Indian startups and U.S. MNCs.  But perhaps the most rewarding part has been the two-way learning. Each session, each conversation, has helped me reflect, sharpen my understanding, and grow. Preparing for calls often pushed me to explore topics more deeply‚Äîteaching me just as much as I shared.  It's been a truly enriching experience on both sides. üôè
position_description_3: DataTrek is my personal passion project‚Äîa one-stop channel for all things Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI.  We dive into ML fundamentals, industry use cases, cutting-edge research papers, blogs, and the evolving world of LLMs and Generative AI‚Äîbasically, everything that fuels the AI revolution.  With a growing community of 10,000+ subscribers, I‚Äôm humbled to see the impact‚Äîfrom helping learners strengthen their foundations and switch careers, to supporting professionals in solving real-world problems at work.  Grateful for the small but strong fanbase within the data science community. The journey has just begun! üöÄ
position_description_4: My startup journey began with Meesho, a super fast-paced company known for hiring top-tier talent and having strong leadership. üöÄ  As the leader of the Ad-tech Data Science team, I specialized in Recommendation Systems and Advertising Monetization Platforms. My focus was on achieving platform revenue goals, enhancing user experiences, and maximizing ROI for suppliers.  I worked on building conversion models, bid optimization algorithms (auto campaigns with auto-bidding), differential slotting, and budget pacing, which increased seller campaign runtime by approximately 2 hours and boosted ROI by ~5%.  We developed an intelligent Supplier Ad Platform, leveraging causal inference (uplift modeling) to create cutting-edge ad recommendations that maximized ROI based on real-time demand-supply gaps. This platform also provided budget suggestions and performance forecasts.  Additionally, we developed algorithms to identify and promote potential best sellers through ad campaigns.  At the final stage of my Meesho journey, I also focused on User Growth alongside Ads. We developed specialized notification algorithms, optimizing the type and frequency of notifications to boost user engagement while managing the purchase-risk-to-mute tradeoff. Additionally, I utilized market mix modeling to assess ROI across multiple acquisition and marketing channels (e.g., Facebook, Google, IPL, TV, YouTube, discounts), enabling the branding team to make data-driven decisions for optimal budget allocation.  I collaborated closely with Data Science juniors, product, business, and platform teams, ensuring continuous delivery and aligning with business objectives through a strong trust in Data Science capabilities.
position_description_5: I began my career at Walmart and spent 5.5 incredible years in this people-centric organization, which will always hold a special place in my heart. ‚ù§Ô∏è  As part of the Data Science team, I played a pivotal role in developing pricing strategies, including sales forecasting, determining optimal markdown/discount percentages, calculating item elasticities, learning item representations (embeddings), and identifying strategic investment opportunities.  In addition to pricing, I made significant contributions to E-commerce Fraud Detection, where I discovered fraud signatures (customer, seller, associates-led frauds), built predictive scoring models, and detected multi-party collusions. I worked closely with cross-functional teams ‚Äî including Business and Engineering ‚Äî to deliver an innovative fraud detection and prevention solution for returns, cancellations, collusions, sellers, and other marketplace frauds.  As a Senior Data Scientist, I led the development, testing, integration, and presentation of multiple fraud prevention system modules, saving costs and streamlining processes. I also contributed to the field by developing a novel linkage algorithm, which was open-sourced for broader adoption and advancement.  Additionally, I participated in innovative proof-of-concept projects within the Retail domain, leveraging Big Data and GPU computing. I specialized in large-scale analytics using Walmart's vast data resources and cutting-edge technologies.  Throughout my time at Walmart, I shared my work through blogs, conference presentations, and research papers. I also filed two patents:  Rule-based Automated Retail Product Line Linkage: A system that automatically links new retail products to existing product lines by analyzing categories, features, and descriptions.  Markdown Optimization System: A system that automates clearance markdown planning, optimizing pricing strategies to maximize sales and revenue.
position_description_8: After my 3rd year of graduation, I had the incredible opportunity to intern under DRDO scientists, working on cutting-edge research. DRDO was ahead of its time, leveraging GPU computing well before the AI boom.  I contributed to two major projects: 1. Radar Imaging Using Parallel Processing in GPU 2. Radar Detection of Buried Objects with the Kirchhoff Migration Algorithm  As part of the projects, I worked with CUDA and OPENCL to program GPUs for parallel processing. Additionally, I implemented a Voice Security Module for authentication. Technologies Used: CUDA, OPENCL, C++
education_1: International Institute of Information Technology Hyderabad (IIITH)
education_description_1: After graduation, I was blessed to join IIIT Hyderabad in the CSE department, one of India's premier institutes. From day one, I was amazed (and honestly a little intimidated) by the incredible talent around me. It pushed me to work harder to match the pace and caliber of my peers.  I spent countless hours in competitive programming, eventually becoming a Codeforces Expert, winning multiple HackerEarth contests, and clearing Google Code Jam three times. During this time, I was also introduced to Machine Learning ‚Äî a new field back then ‚Äî without knowing how big a part it would play in my future career.  IIIT Hyderabad‚Äôs project-intensive curriculum gave me hands-on experience across subjects. I built a search engine (Information Retrieval), a custom shell terminal (Operating Systems), orchestrated a distributed cloud environment, and developed projects in sentiment analysis, opinion mining, and more.  This amazing journey ended with my placement at Walmart as a Statistical Analyst.
education_2: North Eastern Regional Institute of Science and Technology (NERIST)
education_description_2: This is the place where it all began ‚Äî the foundation of my journey into the world of technology.  During my time here, I was introduced to the core concepts of Computer Science: Computer Architecture, Operating Systems, Compiler Design, Databases, and most importantly, Data Structures. These subjects didn't just shape my academic understanding ‚Äî they sparked a deeper passion for problem-solving and innovation.  The CSE department and its faculty played a crucial role in shaping me, both technically and personally. Their kindness, guidance, and unwavering support helped turn a curious boy into a confident professional.  Whenever I get the opportunity, I would love to give back ‚Äî in any small way I can ‚Äî to the institute that gave me so much.
education_description_3: I did my schooling at Kendriya Vidyalaya, Itanagar, Arunachal Pradesh. Growing up in the serene mountains of Arunachal, I spent most of my childhood and academic years there, all the way through graduation.  My school years instilled in me the belief that perseverance can reshape one's destiny. I was an average student once, but consistent effort, support from my teachers, and self-belief helped me rise to become one of the board toppers. I carry with me a deep respect for teachers ‚Äî their dedication shapes not just our academic performance but the kind of individuals we grow up to be.  Driven by a strong interest in technology and problem-solving, I chose the Science stream in high school, with Computer Science as my optional subject instead of Biology. My early curiosity about engineering and software guided this decision, setting the foundation for my journey in the tech world.

organization_title_1: Principal Engineering Manager, InMobi DSP [Demand Side Platform]
position_description_1: Inmobi is India‚Äôs first Unicorn startup and a global mobile advertising and marketing technology company that specializes in in-app advertising, programmatic media buying, and data-driven customer engagement.  InMobi DSP is a comprehensive machine learning powered in-app programmatic advertising platform designed to enhance performance marketing for advertisers. It facilitates the entire ad buying process, enabling advertisers to effectively engage and acquire users through targeted campaigns.   https://advertising.inmobi.com/dsp  Inmobi DSP is a planet scale system that serves ads at few million requests per second, inferring ML models for key decisioning such as evaluating quality of ad requests, computing the relevancy of users per advertising opportunity\campaign for every request, computing the bid value, bid shading, maximizing surplus while bidding, budget pacing and ad creatives selection at a planet scale.    Role:   Leading a 40+ member engineering team to transform one of the world‚Äôs largest programmatic media buying platform (iDSP) into an ML-powered DSP. I am currently driving technology strategy, leading the end-to-end execution, collaborate across the functions, and in driving the operational excellence with the goal of scaling revenue to few billion dollar plus.  My Responsibilities encompass Technology Strategy, Technical Leadership, Execution and Delivery, People, Cross Functional Collaboration, Innovation and Thought Leadership.  Technology: Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Aerospike, MLOps, DevOps, Microservices, Data Engineering, Data Observability.  #EngineeringLeadership, #AdTech, #DSP (Demand Side Platform), #AdExchange, #MarTech, #MachineLearning, #BigData, #TechStrategy, #DistributedSystems, #EngineeringManagement

headline: Staff Data Scientist | Reinforcement Learning, AdTech, AI Personalization, RecSys | PhD@Mila Dropout in RL | Ex-Amazon Science, Adobe
summary: I am a Data Scientist with over 10 years of experience in machine learning, reinforcement learning (RL), and AI-driven personalization across industry and academia. My expertise lies in designing scalable AI algorithms for personalization, recommendation systems, and decision intelligence‚Äîleveraging reinforcement learning, deep learning, and statistical modeling to drive impactful solutions.  Currently, I work on AI-powered personalization and reinforcement learning for recommender systems, optimizing user experiences through dynamic app restructuring, notification management, and behavioral modeling. My research has focused on hierarchical RL, continual learning, safe RL, and off-policy learning, with applications in user engagement, ad optimization, and multi-agent decision-making.  I dropped out of my Ph.D. at McGill University & Mila after 3years. I was advised by Prof. Doina Precup where I worked on hierarchical RL in continual learning setups and efficient exploration techniques for multi-task RL. My research focused on designing principled RL algorithms that can leverage structure, discover abstractions, and generalize across environments. I want to learn generalizable temporal abstractions that can help an agent in a continual learning setup.  My prior industry roles at Amazon Science, AngelOne, Sportlogiq and Adobe have given me hands-on experience in scalable ML pipelines, reinforcement learning for recommender systems, and applied AI in large-scale industrial settings.  I am passionate about bridging cutting-edge AI research and real-world applications, particularly in personalization, ads optimization, and recommendation systems. If you're working on challenging AI problems and would like to connect, feel free to reach out!
position_description_2: * Leading AI-powered personalization initiatives, including reinforcement learning-based app restructuring, notification optimization, search optimization, and customer behavior modeling to enhance user engagement. * Developing and deploying RL-based recommender systems to dynamically rank and personalize homepage content, improving user retention and conversion rates. * Driving data-driven experimentation and A/B testing to validate model impact, ensuring measurable business improvements.
position_description_3: * Ph.D. candidate with Prof. Doina Precup at McGill University and Mila, Montreal, Canada broadly interested in reinforcement learning.  * Focused on designing principled reinforcement learning algorithms that can leverage structure, discover abstractions, and generalize across environments. Worked on learning generalizable temporal abstractions that can help an agent in a continual learning setup.
position_description_4: * Developed a batch off-policy reinforcement learning pipeline for long-term user engagement optimization in recommender systems. * Designed an end-to-end scalable RL-based recommendation framework, integrating user interactions and content signals to improve personalized ranking models. * Collaborated with cross-functional teams to deploy offline RL models at scale, enhancing Amazon‚Äôs ability to drive long-term user satisfaction.
position_description_5: * Led predictive modeling for sports analytics, leveraging time-series ML models to extract real-time game insights for professional sports teams and broadcasters. * Developed deep learning architectures (CNNs, RNNs, autoencoders) for player behavior modeling and event prediction. * Built an automated sports betting tool, integrating RL-based risk-aware strategies to place optimized wagers while tracking bookmaker odds. * Applied inverse reinforcement learning and generalized value functions (GVFs) to extract team-specific strategies.

headline: Director | Platform & Quality Engineering | Ex-Razorpay | Scaling FinTech & Cloud Infra | Driving Resilience & Cost Efficiency
summary: Engineering leader with 18+ years of experience in FinTech, DevOps, and cloud infrastructure, I bring a proven track record of scaling platforms, optimizing performance, and driving operational excellence. At Razorpay, where I served as Associate Director (2019‚Äì2024), I led infrastructure transformation initiatives that delivered 62% cloud cost savings and enabled the platform to handle a 30x spike in TPS during high-profile events like IPL and Big Billion Day. By implementing real-time dashboards and auto-scaling strategies, I ensured high availability, reliability, and seamless performance across critical systems.  A core focus of my work has been embedding observability and automation at scale. I successfully onboarded and configured tools such as New Relic, Grafana, and Coralogix across 20+ microservices, improving incident response and reducing MTTD/MTTR through actionable alerts, drift detection, and robust monitoring pipelines. I developed custom dashboards using Prometheus and Grafana for system health, business metrics, and latency, while driving GitHub-based automation to strengthen release workflows. These efforts directly improved developer experience by 30%, reduced PR cycle time from 5 days to under 2, and proactively prevented 70% of financial leakages‚Äîcutting monetary loss by 80%.  My technical leadership spans across CI/CD automation, performance engineering, cloud security, and container orchestration. I implemented shift-left security and DDoS protection mechanisms that reduced vulnerabilities by 95%, supported scalable architecture through Kubernetes and Docker, and standardized best practices in observability documentation and runbook creation. I‚Äôve consistently empowered engineering and DevOps teams by closing SDLC gaps, streamlining deployment, and ensuring production stability with measurable results.  Certified in Cyber Security Assessment (LearnTube, 2025), Supervised Machine Learning (Stanford/DeepLearning.AI, 2025), and Generative AI (GrowthSchool, 2024), I continue to explore emerging technologies to solve complex engineering challenges. I lead with a collaborative, customer-centric mindset‚Äîmentoring teams, aligning vision with execution, and enabling business-impacting infrastructure strategies. My passion lies in building secure, resilient systems that scale with purpose and deliver measurable outcomes.

Drove collaboration between QA, DevOps, and product teams to embed quality and performance into early SDLC stages.

headline: Data Scientist- III at Inmobi | Ex-Flipkart | IISc Alumni
summary: currently  I'm  working in building chatbot solutions for seller support in e-commerce using GenAI. I had experience previously working in Recommendations NLP domain. Prior to this I had done my M.Tech at Indian Institute of Science in Electrical Engineering, specializing in systems science and automation.
position_description_2: I‚Äôve recently joined Flash.co as a Machine Learning Engineer and am currently leading all the machine learning projects within the company. Excited to be part of this journey and looking forward to making a significant impact through innovative solutions.
position_description_3: Seller Chatbot, Size and Fit Recommendation, User Journey Gamification, Personalisation of Content on Supercoin page, Auto question answering, Review Ranking, AB Platform
position_description_4: During my 6+ years at Flipkart, I had the opportunity to work on several cutting-edge machine learning projects that significantly impacted both customer experience and business outcomes.  One of my key projects was designing and implementing the Seller Intelligent Assistant (SIA), an NLP-powered chatbot for Flipkart sellers. This involved creating a sophisticated architecture with components like a Contextual Query Generator, hierarchical intent classification, and Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), using Transformer-based models and GPT-3.5 turbo.  I also led the development of a Journey Gamification system, introducing a level-based structure to enhance user retention. By deploying a neural network-based personalized high-value action recommendation model, we saw a 0.12% improvement in C/UV and a 2.2% increase in monthly retention during online A/B testing.  In the fashion category, I developed a size and fit recommendation system using customer feedback and product features, resulting in improved F1 scores and a 33bps reduction in return rates. Additionally, I created an auto-answering system for user queries, implemented across the Mobiles vertical, improving both engagement and conversions.  Other highlights include building a non-personalized review ranking system, leading to an 11bps improvement in net conversion, and personalizing the Super Coin Zone through an FTRL-based online learning model, which boosted CTR and reduced bounce rates.  I am now excited to bring these experiences to my new role at Flash.co, where I‚Äôll be leading all machine learning projects.

headline: Senior Software Developer | Next.js, Node.js, MongoDB
summary: As a Senior Software Developer at FanCraze, I am passionate about creating immersive and engaging experiences for cricket fans using cutting-edge web technologies. I have handled the development and deployment of the front end for the MVP of FanCraze using Next.js, a React framework that offers fast performance, SEO optimization, and PWA support.   I have also created complex and animated components that are responsive and user-friendly on mobile devices and worked on critical features such as Flash Game, Blockchain Payment, KYC, and the Referral Reward program. In addition, I am working on creating a cross-platform mobile application using React Native. I have a strong background in web development, with skills in React.js, Node.js, MongoDB, TypeScript, and Express.js. My goal is to continue learning and growing as a web developer, and to contribute to the innovation and success of FanCraze and its vision of building the metaverse of cricket. I enjoy working with a talented and collaborative team that shares my enthusiasm and passion for web development and cricket.

headline: Co-Founder at Mopid
summary: 9 years of hustling has led me to understand First principles from the fundamentals.  I firmly believe that you can always go one step beyond in understanding the problem.  Skilling is a problem that goes way beyond learning. Our survival depends on how well the human race can learn and adapt. In a world where time comes with a premium, static learning is a huge backlog for the human race, with a lot of time getting wasted.  Examarly, as a product is built around the philosophy that -  Learning, if personalised, can save a lot of time.   Being a self-learner all my life, I have a stronghold on the concepts of the problem and the market.  At Examarly, we are building a decentralised ecosystem of learning, where content is sourced from the community itself and provides upward mobility to learners.  Hence, content & knowledge become decentralised, within the community.  Education comes full circle.  At Examarly, we are making this come true. Utopia is to upskill and make learning possible even at the remotest corners of the world for free.
position_description_1: Ai agentic workflow automation for recruitment.
position_description_2: An initiative where we are building a community of entrepreneurs who are in the start of their journey to help connect them with the right resources, people and mentorship.
position_description_3: I joined Examarly in January 2020 as the Product Officer having experience in building solutions previously.  My Journey has enabled me to understand businesses from the very core and helped me evolve as a Product & Growth person.  At Examarly i'm leading Product, Marketing & Growth and we aim to curate the internet into a personalised learning path for our users to help them learn at a faster pace.  So far we have achieved upto 60% personalisation and upto 30% faster learning.   Our vision is to decentralise education and make learning possible even at the remotest corners of the world.
position_description_4: Was invited by Josh Talks to talk about my journey and what led me to build Examarly.
position_description_5: After Q&H i started my Retail trading journey, i used to trade in Indian equities, commodities, forex.  Had also joined a trading floor ( Bearstreet ) where i traded in American equities and FTSE.  Alongside this i worked as a Freelance Equity & Business Analyst for HNI's.
position_description_6: Soon after Sunfib Capital we were Aquihired by a Hong Kong Based Cryptocurrency Startup Q&H Capital, Our place of work was New Delhi and we were serving Indian HNI's helping them invest in the cryptocurrency market.  In 2 months we had hit 1cr AUM but soon RBI came up with guidelines declaring cryptocurrencies as illegal tenders which led us to close the company.  Sunfib Capital was restarted after this but my interest had waned by this time and i wanted to explore retail trading &  american equities so didn't join it again.  Learning : Regulations can kill businesses
position_description_7: My Mentor at Share India had started off this venture where we delivered research and education on the capital markets. I joined him after my stint with Share India to help build the company.
position_description_8: My love for businesses made me explore the financial markets.  So after about 2 months of study i joined Share India as an Arbitrager, this was a great experience as it helped me look right inside the brokerage industry and how brokers & the capital markets function.
position_description_9: Joined College for 6 Months after Ni8, College was really boring so dropped out within 6 months to pursue e-commerce with amazon which seemed like a great opportunity.  This led to the setting up of RHO Enterprises (Loved Physics ;) always wanted to keep afloat.  Mobiles was the product of choice (Which was a very bad decision considering the players & capital involved) Stayed afloat for sometime as i also started selling locally branded electronics in my home town and via ebay.  Also tried to launch a clothing brand (fast fashion based ) which never took off as demonetisation happened and there was a significant shock to the supply chain.  To make a place for myself in the marketplace i had to have good seller ratings which was not possible to achieve quickly with mobile phones as i was operating on limited quantity. For this what i did was picked up the best selling book in India (HC Verma, Physics again ;) and sold it at half the price, and included a rate us flyer inside every book, with led to very good seller ratings on the marketplace which in turn led to a 5x growth in my product sales.  The operations involved were really complex and as i couldn't maintain inventory, communication with my customers & product delivery was taking alot of time Amazon blocked me.
position_description_10: A brief stint with Food Delivery before college started.  Me & Friends got together to solve the problem of availability of food at night in my home town Prayagraj.  Ran it for around 6 months, niched down on a single college that we started serving, made the packaging really creative so that we can generate Word of mouth.  Made a good amount of money and served many customers. We had never thought about running it at scale so initially closed it down.  Learnings : Customer Experience helps generate WOM The brand name is very important, as their was no association with the name we chose and what we did.

headline: Lead Engineer at Cred.
summary: A tech leader with a decade of software engineering experience, specialising in FinTech and consumer lending for 6 years. A driving force behind high-performance, high-traffic systems; designing and building solutions exceeding the stringent quality standards required in the FCA-regulated space.
position_description_2: This role involves the technical leadership of all 10 software and QA engineers in building, supporting and maintaining all parts of Oakbrook's lending and servicing platform.  - Following the dissolution of the product management team, I have taken on the responsibility of the technical roadmap ensuring that the correct initiatives are being prioritised to support Oakbrook's financial plan. - Providing architectural and technical advice to the engineers on the team to ensure the correct balance is being made between technical purity and delivery cadence.
position_description_3: This role involved leading the 3 product squads that made up the Lending tribe, comprised of up to 20 software and QA engineers. This covered all aspects of the customer acquisition journey such as aggregator integrations with Oakbrook's Loan API,  automated credit decisioning, and fraud checks to onboard up to 5000 new customers per month.  - Worked alongside the principal product manager of the Lending tribe to ensure delivery of the technical roadmap across 3 squads. - Provided architectural and technical design support to all 3 squads, ensuring alignment between teams.  - Owned and delivered 8 key engineering principles to the Lending and Servicing tribes, totalling 30-40 software and QA engineers; championing a culture of quality, positivity and customer-value delivery. - Responsible for the resource planning and recruitment of software engineers to ensure that teams were sufficiently resourced to deliver on the initiatives required to meet the financial plan.
position_description_4: Before starting this role, I was one of two engineers working directly with the CTO to design and prototype our new target architecture. This target architecture became the O6K platform that Oakbrook's lending business now runs on. This position involved leading a team of 4 software and QA engineers to deliver Oakbrook's new automated decisioning capability which is now used for several purposes such as credit risk decisioning and fraud checks.  - Prototyped the running of services in a Kubernetes environment using Istio as a service mesh.  - Provisioned the required cloud platform services in Google Cloud using Terraform. - Designed and led the team that implemented the O6K Decision Engine, allowing our data scientists and credit analysts to write and deploy their scorecards and credit policies without software engineer resource. The Decision Engine is now used for 3 million credit risk decisions per month, returning loan offers to 20+ aggregators such as ClearScore and CompareTheMarket.  - Instilled a culture within the team which promoted high performance and personal growth, resulting in two junior engineers becoming Lead Software Engineers.

headline: Entrepreneur, Independent Consultant, Co-Founder and CEO at Aggois (subsidiary of Agribid)
position_description_1: Aggois is subsidiary of Agribid and works on financial intermediation model, doing B2B partnerships with NBFCs for supply of money and tie-ups with channel partners (agribusiness transacting with farmers) to onboard farmers through them (B2B2C approach) for infusion (demand) of money. Products that Aggois offers caters to farmers' financial requirements round the year. There are 2 phases for farmers - cultivation phase and post harvest phase. During cultivation phase, Aggois provides input on credit financing and during post harvest phase, depending on whether farmer's produce gets released to market instantly or in a deferred manner, Aggois provides receivable financing or financing against storage. Aggois' post harvest products helps farmers opt for higher income channels (private institution buyer, government MSP, ability to store and sell at right time) against default APMC channel and by opting for input on credit financing, they can shun relationship with local money lenders. Value for channel partners is effective working capital infusion to grow business and value for financial partners is building high quality agri portfolio and potentially deploying priority sector lending money for the same. Aggois has disbursed ~5.7 Cr of loans with NPA/delinquency under 2%. It has worked with 5 NBFCs, 15 PACS, 8 channel partners, 5 commodities, 4 geographies and 750 farmers.

headline: Simplifying business travel with one app and the industry‚Äôs best support | Co-founder @ITILITE
summary: I used to spend over 250 nights a year traveling as a management consultant at McKinsey.  From missed flights to buried receipts, I experienced the pain of corporate travel first-hand. And let me tell you...  Business travel is broken.  While consumer travel has evolved by tech, business travel is still stuck in the 90s.  65% of companies still book travel manually using Google Flights or Expedia. (Tech Stack Survey by MostlyMetrics)  > Finance teams spend 14+ business days reconciling travel and card statements.  > Travelers wait 30+ minutes on hold when plans change.  > Most tools are clunky, disconnected, and just‚Ä¶ frustrating.  In 2025, business travel is already surpassing pre-pandemic levels.  And it‚Äôs only going to increase‚Äîthanks to hybrid work, cross-border teams, and the pressure to reconnect.  But here‚Äôs the problem:  When businesses finally look to modernize travel, they‚Äôre met with legacy platforms issues that ruins a customer experience: > Bad UX ‚Äî feels like using software from 2003 > Poor automation ‚Äî booking, reporting, and reimbursements are still manual > Terrible support ‚Äî stuck with AI bots or long wait times when every second matters  That‚Äôs why I co-founded Itilite.  Itilite is the modern, all-in-one platform for corporate travel, expense, and payments.  We‚Äôve reimagined how travel works ‚Äî for travelers, finance teams, and ops leaders. > Book flights, hotels, and cars on a simple UI > Booking and expense reporting in one-click > Get 24/7 human support that replies in under 30 seconds  Instead of just digitizing the chaos, we eliminate it.  And the results speak for themselves: > A Fortune 500 client reduced reconciliation time from 14 days to 30 minutes > Improved the productivity of 5 full-time travel coordinators by 50% > Trusted by 500+ companies  What do our customers say?: > My travelers get connected to support in 10 seconds‚Äîand they handle everything. ‚Äì Tara Floz, Exactera > As an admin, the platform‚Äôs clean, intuitive layout made adding users extremely easy and quick. ‚Äì Giancaro Valera, JCDecaux  If you‚Äôre are tired of juggling tools, messy reconciliation, and emergency calls at 2am‚Äîhere‚Äôs how I can help:  ‚û°Ô∏è Book a demo ‚Äî I‚Äôll walk you through how we bring all your travel needs into one app with a simple UI and the industry's best support  ‚û°Ô∏è Follow me here ‚Äî I post free content sharing everything I‚Äôve learned on how to make business travel easy and save costs   A bit about me:  ‚Üí Proud dog parent of my Labrador, Klay  ‚Üí NBA junkie  ‚Üí Never set out to build a company until a fashion e-commerce start-up changed that

education_description_1: MTech Project: A Bandit-based Framework for Self-evaluation in Autonomous Learning Agents  An RL agent‚Äôs performance is not guaranteed to increase monotonically with training. We must evaluate the agent at intermediate stages, which is expensive in a stochastic environment. I worked on a meta¬≠ framework where an agent has to supervise its own training. It models the intermediate stages of the agent as the arms of a Multi-Armed Bandit, to detect and stop sub¬≠optimal iterations early. The saved computation is redirected to training, improving the agent‚Äôs overall performance.  MTech Seminar: Deep Reinforcement Learning  Literature survey of Deep-Q-Learning(DQN), it's variants and deep neural network architectures. Implemented DQN in Tensorflow.  Graduate Teaching Assistant:  CS 747: Foundations of Intelligent and Learning Agents CS 344: Artificial Intelligence

headline: Generative AI || QRT ll IIT Guwahati || MPI-INF  || Franklin Templeton ll Qualcomm
summary: I specialize in building AI-powered solutions that drive operational efficiency and deliver actionable insights. My expertise spans across advanced AI frameworks and technologies, including:  - Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) & GraphRAG: Designing and deploying AI models that combine retrieval mechanisms and knowledge graphs to enhance response accuracy and provide deeper contextual understanding.  - Agentic AI for RAG: Building intelligent AI agents that autonomously handle complex tasks, enabling dynamic data retrieval and adaptive decision-making in RAG systems.  - Text-to-SQL: Developing AI systems that convert natural language queries into SQL, facilitating seamless interaction with databases and enabling non-technical users to access structured data effortlessly.  - LLM Fine-Tuning with LoRA: Fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) using Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) for efficient and scalable customization, improving model performance on domain-specific tasks while reducing computational overhead.  - Optimizing BERT for NER: Fine-tuning BERT using the BIO tagging scheme to accurately identify and classify entities in domain-specific texts, enhancing Named Entity Recognition (NER) performance and data processing.  - Embeddings & Vector Search: Implementing and optimizing embedding models and vector search techniques to improve information retrieval, including large-scale similarity matching.  - LangChain Integration: Utilizing LangChain to build robust, scalable AI pipelines that integrate large language models (LLMs) with external data sources, APIs, and vector databases.  - LangGraph: Leveraging LangGraph to create advanced, graph-based workflows that enable multi-step reasoning, decision-making, and complex task orchestration using large language models.  - Cognitive AI Search: Designing advanced search frameworks that leverage AI to deliver contextually relevant insights, enhancing knowledge discovery and decision support.  I am passionate about pushing the boundaries of AI technology to streamline workflows, improve search accuracy, and empower teams with intelligent, data-driven insights.

education_description_1: Master Thesis: Lumping of Approximate Master Equations for Networks Modeling and Simulation Group - University of Saarland  Pair Approximation or Degree Based Mean Field approaches are often used to understand the epidemic or information spreading phenomenon in social networks. This requires solving ODEs that depends upon the various possible states of an agent and the maximum degree of the network. In our work, we tried to overcome the computational limitations of existing approaches when the number of possible states or the maximum degree of the network is very large. A novel lumping algorithm which is almost 50 times faster than current approaches is developed.

headline: paperplane | Previously Founder-CEO, Stoa | 12 years tinkering around
summary: Hi, I'm Aditya, Co-Founder of Stoa. An IIM-B and BITS Pilani alumnus, I've built and sold two startups in the past and now I'm building my third with Stoa ‚Äî India's best alternative to the traditional MBA that helps you grow a business brain in 24 weeks and find your feet in India's thriving startup ecosystem.   StoaMBA helps you master the language of business and gain competence and clarity to succeed in business roles at high-growth startups. Or, you can simply think of it as business education reimagined for the internet age, where you learn 80% of what matters in 20% of the time and money.   Build your confidence and skills. Get high-paying jobs at funded startups.  https://www.stoa.com/  An education entrepreneur at heart, I believe that building profitable businesses is India's only real chance to create wealth and prosperity for 1+ billion people. And for that, we need to build institutions where every motivated and ambitious individual can get a quality business education that's practical and viable.   I'm trying to build one with Stoa School. And it is my shot at building the Indian dream.    My past ventures:   - Built Learning Outcomes, an assessment analytics company (acquired by Liga EduTech)   - Built BabyOnBoard, a memories and milestones platform for early years (acquired by RoundGlass) - Built India's first Socio-Emotional Wellbeing Program for Schools (@RoundGlass)  Best way to reach me is via DMs or write to me at aditya@stoaschool.com

summary: I‚Äôm a Data Security Engineer with over 9 years of experience helping organizations build scalable, enterprise-grade security programs that align with both business priorities and regulatory expectations.  My core strengths lie in Data Protection, Incident Response, and Security Engineering, with deep hands-on expertise across tools like DLP, CASB, DSPM, UEBA, IRM, and SIEM. I‚Äôve led security initiatives across leading firms including Groww, Flipkart, Myntra, EY, and Credit Suisse, often at critical points of scale, transformation, or regulatory scrutiny.  Beyond deploying technology, I focus on building structured, resilient frameworks‚Äîautomating compliance workflows, driving governance, and leading breach investigations with clarity and speed. I‚Äôve also built in-house tools and real-time dashboards that have helped security teams reduce manual overhead and gain visibility where it matters most.  Notable achievements include: 1. Leading data protection rollouts across cloud and SaaS environments at Flipkart and Groww 2. Building and enforcing structured PII security programs with classification, threat mitigation, and continuous oversight 3. Automating critical reporting pipelines, saving 40+ hours/month in team workload 4. Winning multiple awards for innovation, incident handling, and operational efficiency  I bring the mindset of a builder and a strategist‚Äîsomeone who can zoom into technical depth while keeping the broader business risk in view.  Always open to conversations around data security leadership, risk strategy, and evolving threat landscapes.   #Tags:  #DataSecurity #Cybersecurity #DLP #CASB #DSPM #IncidentResponse #SecurityEngineering #ComplianceAutomation #RiskManagement #DataGovernance #IRM #CloudSecurity #SecurityDashboards #WomenInTech #SecurityLeadership #SecurityTools #DataPrivacy #SecurityAutomation #Infosec #SecurityInnovation #InformationSecurity #SecurityArchitecture  #SecurityOperations #SecurityStrategy #ProactiveSecurity #GovernanceRiskCompliance #SecurityFrameworks #LeadEngineer

Established and maintained calendars for incoming equipment, lab consumables, and infrastructure. position_description_6: 3rd Year, Faculty of Health Sciences. Genes are important factors in determining biological function, but the expression of genes is more than just a matter of gene sequence. position_description_8: Led a knowledge translation initiative as Video and Data Project Lead, collaborating with Environment and Climate Change Canada, the Oil Sands Monitoring Program, the Alberta Trappers Association, and First Nations communities.   Together, our team:  Created a database (MySQL) from extensive Microsoft Excel files containing diverse data on compounds, diseases, and tracking from numerous animals (i.e. fisher, otter, marten) at various trapline locations in Alberta. Analyzed and condensed toxicological data into a biota-quality score and monitoring thresholds.  Developed a user-friendly website for efficient dissemination of toxicant data, optimized data flow, easy updates, and clear visuals. Developed an interactive map of traplines, analyzed graphs with clear thresholds, incorporated satellite images, all linked to an automatically updatable database. Developed multimedia components to effectively communicate the purpose, process, and significance of the initiative. Led a team in creating impactful scripts and storyboards to inform the public and local hunters/trappers about oil sands activity. Addressed the potential impact on wildlife health in collaboration with key stakeholders.
position_description_9: Focused on awareness-building, content creation, cessation strategies, and policy changes related to smoking tobacco and marijuana, particularly within multi-unit housing, smoke-free campuses, and mental health contexts. Emphasized public health initiatives to enhance knowledge dissemination and access to care. Youth Empowerment and Town Hall Leadership: Co-led the first-ever Youth Town Hall (2018), moderating a panel discussion with key stakeholders in Healthy Public Policy, Tobacco Enforcement, Leave the Pack Behind, and Toronto Fire Services. Conducted a Call-to-Action Case Scenario Activity focusing on smoke issues in multi-unit housing, emphasizing the importance of youth involvement in public health decision-making. Toolkit Development: Collaborated with Toronto Public Health staff on creating public toolkits (2016, 2018) providing information on key steps to address hookah bylaws, tenant laws, smoking symptoms related to internal physical health, mental health, and property damage. Contributed to the promotion of smoke-free environments in multi-unit houses, aligning with public health objectives.  Community Engagement through Street Buzz Videos: Interviewed youth on the street to create street buzz videos (2016, 2017) addressing current health issues related to smoking, addiction, and mental health faced by street-involved youth. Utilized innovative approaches for community engagement and awareness. Policy Advocacy: Presented at a Board of Health meeting to approximately 250 staff (2016), advocating for a by-law banning hookah smoking. Convinced stakeholders of the benefits of the by-law, highlighted community preferences, and outlined progressive next steps.
position_description_10: Researched the in vitro effects of oil sand toxicants on mammalian reproductive biology, focusing on first-trimester trophoblasts to identify high-priority gene targets influencing placentation and fetal development. Conducted in-depth transcriptomic pathway analyses to explore the impact of toxicant exposure on placentation and epithelial-to-mesenchymal cell transition. Utilized advanced techniques to decipher gene expression patterns, molecular interactions, and potential links to cancer-like pathology.  Thesis: Adverse Effects of Naphthenic Acids on Placental Health and Development: Evaluating Differential Transcriptomic Pathways in First Trimester Trophoblasts.  Trained and managed the projects of incoming lab students investigating the effects of environmental toxicants and putative government replacements on placental and metabolic pathways. Oversaw the hypothesis generation, experiment development, cell culture protocols, cell viability and invasion assays, primer design, PCR and many technical assays: transcriptomics, genomics and protein-related.  Facilitated ongoing research projects in the lab, including the study of steroidogenic effects of oil sand toxicants, as well as the impact of cigarette smoke and THC strains in placental and liver cell-lines.

position_description_2: DEMOCRACY 2.0 Enough has been said/written on the topic that the Canadian democracy is failing its people. It has been fully hijacked by the politicians exploiting the inherent design flaws of democratic system.  SHORT ELECTORAL CYCLE: Politicians can only think short term & do whatever to win next elections -completely forgetting the fact that the country is FOR EVER.  MEANINGLESS POLICIES: Politicians would like to offer policies like free money to public, tax breaks, false promises etc., to woo voters while completely ignoring the impact on country‚Äôs long-term prospects.  SELFISH CONNECTIONS: Parties & their politicians, blindly following ‚Äúright‚Äù or ‚Äúleft‚Äù or ‚Äúgreen‚Äù etc., are connected to special interest groups, corporations and organizations with vested interests. Policies are proposed to serve those masters who provide the vote bank and big funding. Hence as the new party wins the elections, all or most of the policies of previous government are ‚Äúall of a sudden become useless‚Äù & systematically reversed wasting billions of dollars to serve new groups (NOT FOR CANADA or CANADIANS).  GROWW is a non-profit entity with TWO goals to design a new Democratic System:  SHORT TERM: To create awareness so that citizens actively participate in the democratic system to ensure that GOOD PROFESSIONALS are motivated into politics and selected.  LONG TERM: To completely redefine the prevailing democratic system in Canada where the long term (25-50 years) policies are developed PROFESSIONALLY and with "CANADA FIRST" approach - NOT by blindly following LEFT or RIGHT or GREEN etc ideologies.  It is sheer stupidity to believe that ALL the problems/issues that Canada is facing can be addressed by thoughtlessly following LEFT or RIGHT or GREEN ideologies. ON THE CONTRARY, GROWW believes that EVERY problem/issue would need a professionally evaluated mix of these ideologies to design an ideology to find steady & long term solutions which truly benefit Canada & the whole world.
position_description_3: One stop platform for climate/Carbon solutions with the goal of helping businesses and organizations in minimizing Greenhouse Gas (GHG) footprint (a) To advance education by creating educational materials, including but not limited to, print, webinars and websites for the use of the public with respect to the importance of climate change, and its impact on the planet and all living beings.  (b) To encourage the preservation of the environment by providing the public with educational resources and media to combat the negative effects of climate change.  (c) To advance education by developing and delivering courses, workshops and seminars to the public relating to climate change and good practices in how to reduce or offset greenhouse gas emissions in order to counter global warming.  (d) To advance education by developing and delivering courses, materials and presentations to raise business‚Äô awareness of climate change and to collaborate with such businesses to include such climate change initiatives and awareness in their social responsibility model.  (e) To advance education by developing certification levels (1 to 10) for all types of businesses and identifying the steps required for all businesses to reach the highest and best certificate levels.  (f) To assist businesses and individuals regarding the care of greenhouse gas emissions offsets, including but not limited to accounting and consultancy services.  (g) To assist businesses and individuals to reduce and eliminate greenhouse gas emissions by applying best industry practices to and for such businesses and individuals based on all current and future research.  (h) To assist governments, organizations, businesses and individuals to reduce their carbon footprints by entering into short-term and long-term technical projects.
position_description_4: Commercial Real estate
position_description_5: GoldenAge Manor (Canada) Inc. has purchased Madison Manor in Nanton (Alberta) which has been offering Assisted Living for Seniors in a beautiful home setting for 20 years.  At Madison Manor, our goal is to help our clients achieve the best quality of life possible. We understand that one solution does not fit every situation so we take the time to listen and learn about each client's needs and preferences. This enables us to tailor a care program that maximizes the client's independence and dignity.  Understandably, most seniors prefer to stay in the familiar comfort of their own homes. This is why Madison Manor has created a home like atmosphere complemented with a truly caring staff, the next best thing to being at home.  Madison Manor is a 6000 sq./ft. private assisted living residence that generously accommodates ten residents with large bright rooms and ensuites. Enjoy the freedom to live the way you want with assistance when you need it. Our dedicated and caring staff create a family like environment. Wonderful home-style cooking and baking are prepared daily. On-site hairstyling, nail care, entertainment and hobbies are enjoyed by all. The community day-program arrives twice a week for those who like to get out and about.  An in town acreage, located on the west side of Nanton. This beautifully treed property with abundant gardens is perfect for summer strolls with family and friends. Conveniently located, Madison is close to shopping, the post office, the clinic and churches.  Our company is based on the belief that our residents needs are of the utmost importance. Our entire team is committed to meeting those needs. As a result, a high percentage of our business comes from referrals.  https://www.madisonmanor.ca/

headline: Analytics and Data Science @ PharmEasy
summary: Analytics Professional with 5 years of experience in E-commerce and Telecom, focused on driving data-driven growth. At PharmEasy, I enhanced GMV for High Margin Substitutes and Private Label by ~2% through targeted analytics and implemented a first-touch attribution framework that boosted revenue and cross-selling rates  Previously, I worked on demand planning, developing forecasting models that improved SKU selection and enabled fulfillment of up to 95k daily orders. I also optimized inventory management, achieving over 90% order fulfillment. At Hansen Technologies, I automated workflows to reduce order cancellations  Skilled in Data Analytics, Data Visualization, and Machine Learning, I use SQL and Python for data analysis and have built dashboards with Microstrategy and Tableau. I actively participate in hackathons, achieving second runner-up at Vodafone Idea Limited Codefest 2020, and published a paper on 'Suspicious Activity Detection Using Live Video Analysis' in Springer's journal
position_description_1: - Led analytics for HMS and PL verticals, optimizing margins and scaling businesses, increasing GMV contribution of HMS substitutes from 3% to 4.7% in 8 months through targeted product initiatives  - Achieved a ~15% increase in Add-to-Carts (ATCs) and ~10% boost in order volume by optimizing the Private Label homepage funnel using customer segmentation  - Designed a real-time intelligence system for agents, boosting upselling conversion rates from 9% to 12% and enhancing call efficiency  - Introduced a first-touch attribution framework to identify key revenue sources, driving cart feature initiatives that generated an additional ‚Çπ10 Lakhs per month and supported product releases via A/B testing and CleverTap funnels  - Enhanced PL cross-selling through customer cohort analysis, resulting in a 5% increase in conversion rates and adding approximately 1,500 PL customers via the PL Coupon Auto Add feature
position_description_2: - Developed an ensemble of forecasting models, including weighted average, ARIMA, and SARIMA, improving demand accuracy for the B2C business and increasing SKUs in lower MAPE buckets by ~30%.  - Introduced a sensitive moving average model to effectively manage demand spikes (e.g., COVID surge), enabling accurate procurement and fulfilling 90-95k orders daily, up from 60-65k  - Crafted a robust sales trend logic for prioritizing key SKU procurement, consistently achieving over 90% order fulfillment while maintaining 30 days of inventory on hand  - Built order-level SKU logic for mini warehouses and offline stores, redirecting ~50% of orders and optimizing major warehouse inventory  - Designed an automated inventory replenishment system, increasing availability by ~30% and reducing out-of-stock occurrences by ~10%

headline: Founder- Seven Sarees | A D2C saree and heritage textiles brand
summary: It all started with a piece of cloth. Tied at the waist as a basic protection against the natural elements. As time unfurled, this piece of cloth was spun in a 1000 ways , woven in a 1000 more and draped in a 1000 more giving birth to one of the oldest garments alive today, in the closet of every Indian woman , anywhere in the world- the saree.   The single garment made today that lasts for generations can be a truly sustainable way , if revived in its original form and glory, to clothe the world and that sheer thought is what made me start up on my own!   The world today doesn‚Äôt need just long lasting garments, it needs garments that are truly trendy across generations and made with a great attention to detail and supreme respect to quality.
position_description_1: A saree sold as a fast fashion item and ending up in a landfill clearly shows we went wrong somewhere, sometime ago. A lot of heritage weaves and fabric techniques are almost lost in this race to produce more. This is our attempt to get some really great product groups back into mainstream and make products that last for generations. We don‚Äôt think this means we make boring products, we just find interesting ways to make this happen.

headline: Senior Engineering Manager Data Science | AI Leader | ML Engineer

Core Skills  Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Data Science, NLP, Generative AI, Agentic AI, Foundation Model, Computer Vision, Optimisation, Transformer Models, MLOps, FMOps, Programming, Algorithm & Data-structures, CI/CD, Monitoring & Observability, Systems Design, GCP, AWS, Mathematics & Statistics  Technology Stack  Python, Amazon Bedrock, Google Vertex AI, PyTorch, Tensorflow, Huggingface, Amazon Sagemaker, ONNX, FastAPI, GraphQL, Docker, Kubernetes, Datadog, GitHub, GitHub Actions, ArgoCD, Message Queues, Asynchronous Programming, Kubeflow, AWS, GCP, NVIDIA Triton Inference Server, Big Query, Apache Beam, Apache Spark, Big Data Stack (Hadoop), SQLs, PostgreSQL, NoSQL Databases like MongoDB, DynamoDB, Flask API, Uvicorn, Gunicorn, SAS, and R.  Education  Master of Science in Econometrics at University at Buffalo, SUNY, USA (2013 - 2015) GPA: 3.8/4.0 Specialisation in Computational Econometrics, Machine Learning, Optimisation, Algorithms & Statistical Methods  Bachelor of Technology in Electronics & Communication Engineering at WBUT, India (2003 - 2007) GPA: 8.0/10 Specialisation in Algorithms & Data-structures, Operating Systems, Computer Architecture & Mathematics
position_description_1: At PropertyGuru, our mission is to empower people to make confident property decisions through relevant content, actionable insights, and world-class service. I head a talented and diverse Data Science team to deliver this mission across Southeast Asia, serving over 500 million property seekers.  Key Projects & Business Outcomes :  1. Automated Image Moderation Engine - Developed a sophisticated listing image moderation system.  Scalability : Processes 10 million images monthly across SG, MY, VN & TH markets with 98 % correctness with turnaround time in few hours (FMOps) Cost & Time Optimisation : Saves 400 hours of manual review monthly, with 80 % reduction in processing & model inferencing cost using GenAI stack (Gemini in VertexAI)  2. Dynamic Pricing - Developed a data-driven pricing engine designed to optimise product pricing (e.g., Boost, Turbo) based on market demand & supply and competitive insights.  The business outcomes include higher credit consumption and property agent participation in the marketplace with lower cost per action becoming a primary revenue generator for the company.  3. Recommender System - Developed a personalised listing recommendation system and data pipelines using user persona and property listing information. The system is capable of showing hyper-personalised contents and property services tailored to the home-seeker.  The business outcomes include higher CTR, scroll time, discoverability and other user engagement metrics.  4. Automated Property Valuation Engine (ProxyPrice) - Developed an accurate property valuation system for using sophisticated neural network models with spatial, temporal attributes.  The business outcomes include high precision & coverage for home-seekers & property agents and higher traffic to the platform.  5. Developed AI as a Platform to champion GenAI initiatives in the company to foster innovation by building wrapper on Amazon Bedrock, VertexAI, OpenAI, Agent Builders using OpenWebUI and in-house systems
position_description_2: LeadIQ is a prospecting platform built to help SaaS sales teams book more meetings through better prospecting.   I am part of the Scribe team where we are building products which take various sales triggers from a wide range of data sources like social, company etc and composes personalised emails in seconds.   We are working on various generative models like OpenAI GPT3.5, GPT4 and ChatGPT using a robust and scalable technology stack in GraphQL & Pydantic.  I lead an excellent team of engineers specializes in Machine Learning, Backend and Frontend implementation. The team is spread across Singapore, Europe and the US.  * Try Scribe : https://leadiq.com/scribe * Try LeadIQ suite of products : https://leadiq.com/
position_description_3: Leveraging data to build food cognition.   1. Leading Data Science initiatives in building food cognition across various entities including product, consumer, menu / recipes, ingredients, health benefits, trending topics, claims.  2. Machine Learning projects include NLP, semantic search, ranking, named-entity recognition, category classification, multilingual knowledge distillation, computer vision, weak supervision etc.  3. Core member of the tech strategy team including tech adoption, streamlining processes and people management.
position_description_4: Building a conversational AI SaaS product to manage the end-to-end sales process  for enterprises. As a founding member of the ML practice in Salesken, have built and supervised the following use cases.  1. Search Engine : Building a semantic search engine which can match the customer utterances with relevant entities during a sales call and post call analysis so that the agent can serve the customer better. This search engine takes care of both symmetric and asymmetric matching, multi-lingual utterances, code switching and other nuances of a free-flowing conversation. This runs as an asynchronous ML Pipeline.  2. Signal Management System: This system onboards a customer with a minimal human intervention and within a span of 30 minutes (at max). The system takes customer inputs from a wizard and performs various NLU/NLI validations, domain adaptations (by industries) and generate variations using NLG models and persist them as entitles. Asynchronously it augments it with other information from web, documents and previous recorded calls from the CRM using techniques web-scraping, parsing and clustering .  3. Offline Generation of Cues : This system automatically creates/generates a set of questions and answers tuples for a given organization (B2B customer) using hierarchical knowledge graph, constrained text generation to generate various questions based on intentions/situations and using a reader and retriever model (machine comprehension) to retrieve the answers and persist them. This powers the real time cueing system.  4. ML Pipeline (MLOps) : These are asynchronous ML pipelines which execute about 20 Deep Learning models related to Customer Intelligence, Sales Intelligence and the Onboarding process. At a high level the ML pipeline consists of a Publisher and a Subscriber. The subscriber calls those 20 DL models which are running as FastAPI services. This mechanism is handled using callbacks and promises. The pipeline uses Kubernetes cluster and CI/CD using GCP
position_description_5: In continuation to the projects mentioned above, I have been working very actively and supervising the following modules -  5. Call Summarization Modules : A system of ML models which can summarize a conversation between the sales agent and the customer under certain categories namely Question Detection Model, (Dis)Agreement model, Objection Detection Model, Follow-up Action Detection Model, Conversational Adjacency Pairs (Dialog Act) models and Aspect Based Sentiment models. For sparsity of training data used Zero and Few-shot classifiers  6. Selling Best Practices Modules : A system of ML models which quantify the best practices shown by agents during the sales call. They are quantified using series of models for Agent Pitch Score, Conversational (Empathy) Grounding, Engagement Index and Win/Loss prediction model.  7. Multi-lingual Emotion Detection Model : From customer and agent utterances the system detected the emotions with a very high precision. A multi-lingual model XLM-R was fine-tuned on Go-Emotions English corpus and during inference performed a Cross Lingual Transfer on code-switched conversation snippets (Indic and English languages mixed). A lot of complexities are abstracted.  We published this as a paper titled "Curriculum learning for adapting models on Code-Mixed Data in Emotion Recognition" in COLING 2022 (International Conference on Computational Linguistics)  8. Model Optimization : As a continuous improvements to run the DL models in production, we keep optimizing these models using Knowledge Distillation both during Pre-training (Mini or Distil models) and during fine-tuning using Teacher - Student architecture (loss functions) , converting the computational graph into ONNX and running it on dedicated accelerator like ONNX Runtime (ORT) or TensorRT. Have been experimenting with NVIDIA Triton Inference Server, Model Repositories, Model Navigator, Model Analyzer and KServe (manages Triton Inference Server in Kubernetes cluster)
position_description_6: Data Scientist at MADS (Marketing Analytics & Data Science) team of Juniper Networks.  1. Built a content recommender (news & tech-specs documents) based on the customer multi-channel behavior based on semantic matches/searches using state-of-the-art deep learning models like Universal Sentence Encoder.  2. Built a chatbot to automate billing and sales related support using Neural Machine Translation (NMT) models by leveraging word vectors with the help of LSTMs (Long Short-Term Memory) in Encoder/Decoder architecture.  3. Built an end-to-end up sell and cross sell models based on customer intent, recency, product purchase and behavior.  4. Demand forecasting sales model for mid-market enterprises and different customer segmentation to be profitable.
position_description_7: As part of Verizon's Analytics group, I help the business solve Operations problem reducing the cost, improving Digital Channel mix and devising Market Strategy with the help of Data Science. I have also led teams on the Digital Strategy and Machine Learning initiatives.   1. Built a generalized Text Analytics Engine to improve customer‚Äôs online experience and improve the Digital Channel Mix using unstructured text data (customer chats, voice of customers & call notes). Applied models like Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA), Latent Semantic Indexing (LSI), Clustering and various NLP techniques.  2. Predict the FiOS (Verizon Fiber) penetration in the Boston Metropolitan Area for the roll-out plan using both supervised (regression models) and unsupervised (clustering, principal component analysis (PCA)) machine learning techniques.  3. Built a contract renewal model to address 1.7 million Verizon wireline contracts getting expired in 2016 using various classification techniques like logistic regression, and shape the offer and targeted marketing strategy.
position_description_8: I was doing independent research on the following areas of Econometrics & Machine Learning-   1. Discrete Choice problem using Market Simulation on a Computer Choice Study by performing Conjoint Analysis to predict individual consumer choice towards different Computer manufacturers. Estimated brand loyalty, price sensitivity, feature focus, brand switching and optimal pricing using Hierarchical Bayes (HB) MNL Logit model using Markov Chain Monte Carlo Estimation.  2. Optimal workforce estimation and scheduling for a call center of a bank with reference to a target wait-time, using Queueing model and to minimize the cost (constrained optimization problem) using Integer Linear Programming.  3. Facial Expression Recognition ‚Äì a multi class prediction model using Neural Network. Classified a 48 x 48 grayscale image of faces into seven different categories built from scratch (activation functions like RELU, Softmax, Hyperbolic Tangent, backpropagation using Gradient Descent, regularization techniques like Momentum & RMS Prop etc.)
position_description_9: 1. Built an entire CRM for a Dutch Telecom client in the area of Order to Cash, Sales-force, and Service-cycle modules.  2. Consultant for Wireless, Voice and Ethernet products of telecom clients in both consumer and business segments.
position_description_10: 1. Software Development for a telecom provider from the UK in their Operations and Business Support Systems.  2. Worked in Siebel CRM, Data Warehousing, SQL‚Äôs, scripting, workflows and webservice integrations.
education_description_1: Specialization in Econometrics, Optimization, Statistics & Machine Learning.

headline: Data Scientist 1 @Swiggy | Ex @Tiger | Co-Founder at AI Club NITC
summary: As a passionate and dedicated Machine Learning Engineer, I am driven by the transformative power of AI and its applications in solving real-world problems. An alumnus of the National Institute of Technology Calicut (NITC), I bring a strong background in NLP, Computer Vision, and Generative AI, with extensive hands-on experience in Python, PyTorch and TensorFlow. I have three publications, including two in SCI journals, contributing significantly to the field of machine learning.  My professional experience includes fine-tuning and deploying large language models (LLMs) on cloud infrastructure like AWS and Azure, ensuring robust performance and scalability. I have developed and managed data science pipelines, including model retraining and monitoring, to ensure continuous improvement and reliability of AI solutions. I am proficient in Python, C, C++, and SQL, and have a solid understanding of data structures and algorithms, crucial for efficient problem-solving and optimization.  I am always eager to connect with like-minded professionals, collaborate on innovative projects, and explore new opportunities in the AI and machine learning domain. Feel free to reach out to discuss ideas, share insights, or explore potential collaborations.
